width: 140px; background: #000"><div class="img__preloader"></div><noscript><img alt="David Petraeus at the SALT Conference in Las Vegas" class="media__image" src="//cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/190509132641-david-patraeus-large-169.jpg"></noscript><i aria-hidden="true" class="media__icon icon-media-video cnn-icon" data-post-text="02:23 "></i></a></div><div class="cd__content"><h3 class="cd__headline" data-analytics=" (16 Videos)_carousel-medium-strip_video_video"><a><span class="cd__headline-text">Petraeus: Don't expect a deal with China too soon</span><span class="cd__headline-icon cnn-icon"></span></a></h3></div></div></article></div></div><div class="owl-item cloned" style="width: auto;"><div class="cn__column carousel__content__item"><article class="cd cd--card cd--video cd--idx-7 cd--medium cd--vertical cd--has-siblings cd--has-media cd--media__image" data-vr-contentbox="/videos/business/2019/05/08/markets-now-anthony-scaramucci-tariffs.cnn-business/video/playlists/business-trade/" data-eq-pts="xsmall: 0, small: 300, medium: 460, large: 780, full16x9: 1100" data-video-id="business/2019/05/08/markets-now-anthony-scaramucci-tariffs.cnn-business" data-bundle="one_tap" data-ad-section="const-video-leaf" data-section-name="business" data-video-playlist-url="/video/playlists/business-trade/" data-eq-state="xsmall"><div class="cd__wrapper" data-analytics=" (16 Videos)_carousel-medium-strip_video_video"><div class="media"><a><img style="height: 79px; width: 140px; background: #000"><div class="img__preloader"></div><noscript><img alt="" class="media__image" src="//cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/190508122159-20190508-markets-now-09-large-169.jpg"></noscript><i aria-hidden="true" class="media__icon icon-media-video cnn-icon" data-post-text="01:18 "></i></a></div><div class="cd__content"><h3 class="cd__headline" data-analytics=" (16 Videos)_carousel-medium-strip_video_video"><a><span class="cd__headline-text">Scaramucci: If new Trump tariffs take effect, market could drop 7%</span><span class="cd__headline-icon cnn-icon"></span></a></h3></div></div></article></div></div></div></div><div class="owl-nav"><div class="owl-prev" style="height: 78.75px; margin-top: 0px;"></div><div class="owl-next" style="height: 78.75px; margin-top: 0px;"></div></div><div class="owl-dots disabled" style=""></div></div></div></div></div></section></div><div class="pg-rail-tall__body" itemprop="articleBody"><section class="zn zn-body-text zn-body zn--idx-0 zn--ordinary zn-has-multiple-containers zn-has-32-containers" data-eq-pts="xsmall: 0, medium: 460, large: 780, full16x9: 1100" id="body-text" data-vr-zone="zone-1-0" data-zone-label="bodyText" data-containers="32" data-zn-id="body-text" data-eq-state="xsmall medium large"><div class="l-container"><div class="el__leafmedia el__leafmedia--sourced-paragraph"><p class="zn-body__paragraph speakable"><cite class="el-editorial-source">Hong Kong (CNN)</cite>Chinese President Xi Jinping has urged countries not to "close their doors and hide behind them" in his first major public speech since US President Donald Trump raised tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods amid an escalating trade war.</p></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph speakable">Opening the Conference on Asian Civilizations Dialogue in Beijing on Wednesday, Xi said there was no need for "civilizations to clash with each other."</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph speakable">"No civilization is superior over others. The thought that one's own race and civilization are superior and the inclination to remold or replace other civilizations are just stupid," he said, adding to do so would invite "catastrophic consequences."</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><a href="https://www.cnn.com/china" target="_blank">China</a> retaliated to Trump's latest round of increases on Monday, raising tariffs on roughly $60 billion of US exports. One <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/14/asia/china-us-beijing-propaganda-intl/index.html" target="_blank">editorial in state media</a> said "for us, this is a real 'people's war.'"</div><div class="ad ad--epic ad--mobile" data-ad-text="show" style=""><div data-ad-id="ad_rect_atf_02" data-ad-position="mobile" data-ad-refresh="default"></div></div><div class="ad ad--epic ad--tablet" data-ad-text="show" style=""><div data-ad-id="ad_nat_btf_01" data-ad-position="tablet" data-ad-refresh="default"></div></div><div class="ad ad--epic ad--desktop" data-ad-text="show" style=""><div data-ad-id="ad_nat_btf_01" data-ad-position="desktop" data-ad-refresh="default"><div id="ad_nat_btf_01" class="ad-ad_nat_btf_01 ad-refresh-default"></div></div></div><ul class="cn cn-list-hierarchical-xs cn--idx-5 cn-zoneAdContainer" data-layout="list-hierarchical-xs"></ul><div class="el__embedded el__embedded--fullwidth"><div class="el__image--fullwidth js__image--fullwidth"><div><img style="height: 438.75px; width: 780px; background: #000"><div class="img__preloader"></div><noscript><img alt="Chinese president Xi Jinping delivers a speech during the opening ceremony of the Conference on Dialogue of Asian Civilizations at the National Convention Center in Beijing on May 15." class="media__image" src="//cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/190515121938-01-xi-jinping-cdac-large-169.jpg"></noscript><div class="media__caption el__gallery_image-title"><div class="element-raw appearance-fullwidth">Chinese president Xi Jinping delivers a speech during the opening ceremony of the Conference on Dialogue of Asian Civilizations at the National Convention Center in Beijing on May 15.</div></div></div></div></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Trade is just one of several fronts on which the US and China have clashed in recent months. Xi's speech touched on a topic thrown into a spotlight by top US State Department official Kiron Skinner <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JVl_eEmPoK4" target="_blank">in late April</a>, when she controversially said that China was Washington's first "great power competitor that is not Caucasian."</div><div class="zn-body__read-more" style=""><div class="read-more-gradient"></div><div class="read-more-button"><div class="read-more-link" id="js-body-read-more">Read More</div></div></div><div class="zn-body__read-all"><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"When we think about the Soviet Union and that competition, in a way it was a fight within the western family ... That's not really possible with China. This is a fight with a really different civilization and a different ideology," Skinner said.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Speaking at Wednesday's conference, which featured representatives from 47 countries, Xi praised the achievements of China and other Asian nations over the centuries and said all civilizations needed to learn from each other.</div><div class="el__leafmedia el__leafmedia--twitter"><div class="twembed el-embed-twitter"><twitter-widget class="twitter-tweet twitter-tweet-rendered" id="twitter-widget-0" style="position: static; visibility: visible; display: block; transform: rotate(0deg); max-width: 100%; width: 500px; min-width: 220px; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;" data-tweet-id="1128494956262318080"></twitter-widget></div></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><h3>Trade talks on hold</h3></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">As recently as late April, the US and China appeared to be close to ending the year-long trade war.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">But there has been little progress on trade talks since a Chinese delegation left Washington on Friday, sources close to the situation said.</div><div class="el__embedded el__embedded--standard"><div class="el__storyelement--standard el__article--embed"><div class="el__article--teaseimage"><a href="/2019/05/14/politics/donald-trump-xi-jinping-china-trade-war/index.html"><img style="height: 168.75px; width: 300px; background: #000"><div class="img__preloader"></div><noscript><img alt="It&#39;s Trump vs. Xi in the China trade war -- and it&#39;s personal" class="media__image" src="//cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/181102151622-02-trump-xi-china-file-large-169.jpg"></noscript></a></div><div class="media__caption el__storyelement__title"><span class="el__storyelement__header"><a href="/2019/05/14/politics/donald-trump-xi-jinping-china-trade-war/index.html">It's Trump vs. Xi in the China trade war -- and it's personal</a></span></div></div></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Both countries have blamed each other for the breakdown in negotiations, with Trump saying on Tuesday that Beijing "broke" the deal.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"We had a deal that was very close and then they broke it. They really did. I mean, more than just, more than renegotiate, they really broke it. So we can't have that happen," he said.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Nevertheless, Trump appeared to play down the split between the two countries, describing it as a "little squabble."</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">There are still hopes for a deal, with a US trade delegation expected to head to Beijing in the coming weeks.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Xi and Trump are also expected to meet in Japan during the G20 in June.</div><div class="el__embedded el__embedded--fullstandardwidth"><div class="el__storyelement--fullstandardwidth el__article--embed"><div class="el__article--teaseimage"><a href="/2019/05/14/asia/china-us-beijing-propaganda-intl/index.html"><img style="height: 324.625px; width: 577.125px; background: #000"><div class="img__preloader"></div><noscript><img alt="Chinese media calls for &#39;people&#39;s war&#39; as US trade war heats up " class="media__image" src="//cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/190514124148-beijing-forbidden-city-large-169.jpg"></noscript></a></div><div class="media__caption el__storyelement__title"><span class="el__storyelement__header"><a href="/2019/05/14/asia/china-us-beijing-propaganda-intl/index.html">Chinese media calls for 'people's war' as US trade war heats up </a></span></div></div></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><h3>'Fight for a new world'</h3></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Chinese state media has been on the offensive since the recent breakdown of talks, publishing fiercely nationalistic opinion pieces and articles proclaiming China's resilience.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">A statement read during the Monday 7 p.m. newscast on state broadcaster CCTV said China would "fight for a new world," adding that in its long history "there's nothing we haven't seen before."</div><div class="ad ad--epic ad--mobile" data-ad-text="show" style=""><div data-ad-id="ad_rect_btf_01" data-ad-position="mobile" data-ad-refresh="default"></div></div><ul class="cn cn-list-hierarchical-xs cn--idx-28 cn-zoneAdContainer" data-layout="list-hierarchical-xs"></ul><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"As President Xi Jinping pointed out, the Chinese economy is a sea, not a small pond. A rainstorm can destroy a small pond, but it cannot harm the sea. After numerous storms, the sea is still there," anchor Kang Hui said. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">The clip went viral on Chinese social media, where it has been viewed millions of times. CCTV's own post of the clip has has been reposted by most state media accounts.</div></div><p class="zn-body__paragraph zn-body__footer"></p></div><div class="zn-body__read-more-outbrain" style=""><ul
